el:english.el:comment: an attempt has been made to imitate the language Aragorn uses in Tolkien's 'the 2 towers', which itself is an imitation of the ancient english Shakespeare wrote; the most faithful way to translate this is then to use a medieval-looking language.

el:string.el:english: Mightie art the Knightes of The Olde Ages who keepe the Elfic Oxyde Stones, and numerous art the Ghostes who lye in the waye to them; many art the adventurers who tryed to steale Aylendil the Sworde but none has ever come back. Hazy is the swampe where the Magick of the Ancients is buryed; the lair of WhiteHorse the dragon thu shalt avoyd in feare of awaken him ...
el:string.el:translation: Puyssants sont les Chevalyers des Temps Anciens qui gardent les Pyerres oxyd elfyques, et nombreux sont les Espryts qui hantent le chemin qui y conduyt; bien des aventuryers ont voulu voler la Dague Magyque mais personne n'en est revenu. Brumeux est le Marais qui recouvre la Magye des Ancyens; l'antre de Blanc-Cheval le Dragon tu ayviteras, de peur que de son sommeyl il sorte ...
